action.action-desc: Mr. Lieu (for himself, Ms. Brownley, and Ms. Barragán) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to increase the civil and criminal penalties for oil spills, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Increasing Penalties for Offshore Polluters Act.

section.header: Civil and criminal penalties relating to oil spills

subsection.text: Section 311(b)(7) of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act (33 U.S.C. 1321(b)(7)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A) by striking an amount up to each place it appears and inserting an amount that is at least; and
in subparagraph (D) by striking not more than and inserting at least.

subsection.text: Section 309(c) of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act (33 U.S.C. 1319(c)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking not more than 1 year and inserting not more than 2 years; and

by striking punishment shall be by a fine of not more than $50,000 per day of violation, or by imprisonment of not more than 2 years, or by both and inserting the maximum punishment shall be doubled with respect to both fine and imprisonment;
by striking not less that $5,000 and inserting not less than $10,000;
by striking not more than 3 years and inserting not more than 6 years; and

by striking punishment shall be by a fine of not more than $100,000 per day of violation, or imprisonment of not more than 6 years, or by both and inserting the maximum punishment shall be doubled with respect to both fine and imprisonment; and
by striking not more than 15 years and inserting not more than 30 years; and
